intro: Heliocarpus boliviensis, commonly known as the Brazilian chestnut or yellow sycamore, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, bark-like fruit capsules that resemble small, hard nuts. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
